ReferencedObject.Name: Huge
ReferencedObject.Description: Creatures larger than Medium take up more than 1 square. For instance, an ogre takes up a space that is 2 squares by 2 squares. Most Large and larger creatures also have a reach greater than 1, which means they can make melee attacks against creatures that aren’t adjacent to them. A creature’s basic body shape usually determines its reach; a Large ogre has a reach of 2, but a Large horse has a reach of 1.

ReferencedObject.Name: Elemental
ReferencedObject.Description: Elemental creatures are native to the Elemental Chaos.

ReferencedObject.Name: Humanoid
ReferencedObject.Description: Humanoid creatures vary greatly in how much they resemble humans. Most are bipedal.

ReferencedObject.Name: Abyssal
ReferencedObject.Description: Abyssal is a form of Primordial warped and twisted by the evil at the heart of the Abyss.

ReferencedObject.Name: Common
ReferencedObject.Description: Common is a debased form of Supernal, in the way that humans and halflings heard the first language.

ReferencedObject.Name: Draconic
ReferencedObject.Description: Draconic is a debased form of Supernal, in the way that dragons heard the first language.

ReferencedObject.Name: Chaotic Evil
ReferencedObject.Description: Chaotic evil creatures have a complete disregard for others. They kill, steal, and betray others to gain power. Their word is meaningless and their actions destructive. Their worldviews can be so warped that they destroy anything and anyone that doesn’t directly contribute to their interests. By the standards of good and lawful good people, chaotic evil is as abhorrent as evil, perhaps even more so. Chaotic evil monsters such as demons and orcs are at least as much of a threat to civilization and general well-being as evil monsters are. An evil creature and a chaotic evil creature are both opposed to good, but they don’t have much respect for each other either and rarely cooperate toward common goals. For the purpose of game effects, a chaotic evil creature is also considered evil.

ReferencedObject.Name: Darkvision
ReferencedObject.Description: A creature that has darkvision can see normally regardless of light. It ignores concealment that is a result of dim light or darkness.

ReferencedObject.Name: all-around vision
ReferencedObject.Description: Enemies can’t gain combat advantage by flanking a creature that has all-around vision.

ReferencedObject.Name: truesight
ReferencedObject.Description: See blindsight.

ReferencedObject.Name: Demon
ReferencedObject.Description: Demons are chaotic evil elemental creatures native to the Abyss. They don’t need to sleep.

Hit.Name: Hit
Hit.Description: cold and necrotic damage, and the target is slowed (save ends)

ReferencedObject.Name: Cold
ReferencedObject.Description: Ice crystals, arctic air, or frigid liquid.

ReferencedObject.Name: Necrotic
ReferencedObject.Description: Purple-black energy that deadens flesh and wounds the soul.

Hit.Name: Hit
Hit.Description: the target loses two healing surges. If it has only one surge to lose, it also loses its healing surge value in hit points. If it has no surges to lose, it loses its bloodied value in hit points

ReferencedObject.Name: Necrotic
ReferencedObject.Description: Purple-black energy that deadens flesh and wounds the soul.

Hit.Name: Hit
Hit.Description: the target loses a healing surge, and Bel Shalor regains a spent action point

MonsterPower.Name: Action Lash

ReferencedObject.Name: Charm
ReferencedObject.Description: An effect type. A charm power controls a creature’s actions in some way. This control is often represented by the creature being forced to attack its ally or being subjected to the dominated condition.

Hit.Name: Hit
Hit.Description: Bel Shalor slides the target 4 squares

ReferencedObject.Description: Powers that create lingering effects that extend over an area.

ReferencedObject.Description: Purple-black energy that deadens flesh and wounds the soul.

ReferencedObject.Name: Healing
ReferencedObject.Description: Powers that restore hit points.

MonsterTrait.Details: Bel Shalor does not roll initiative. He has three turns each round on initiative counts 45, 35, and 25.
MonsterTrait.Name: Shadow Movement

MonsterTrait.Details: At the start of Bel Shalor’s turn, any dead creature within his aura rises as a dread wraith under his command.
MonsterTrait.Name: Shadows Rise
